author: Thomas M. Burton
title: U.S. Regulators Extend Window for Critical Stroke Treatment
text:
WASHINGTONâ€”U.S. regulators will allow the expanded use of a device that promises to lessen disability in survivors of severe strokes.
The Food and Drug Administration on Thursday extended the time window for use of a device that pulls clots out of large arteries supplying blood to the brain out to 24 hours after the onset of stroke symptoms, up from six.
